DataElement.preferredDefinition: A yes/no indicator related to the dentist's interest in research on chronic pain (pain that can range from mild to severe that persists or progresses over a long period of time) from any condition affecting the anatomic and functional characteristics of the

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Dentist Temporomandibular Joint Disorder Chronic Pain Clinical Study Interest
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the dentist's interest in research on chronic pain (pain that can range from mild to severe that persists or progresses over a long period of time) from any condition affecting the anatomic and functional characteristics of the temporomandibular joint.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An individual licensed for the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of diseases in the oral cavity, adjacent tissues, and related structures.

Concepts.definition: An individual licensed for the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of diseases in the oral cavity, adjacent tissues, and related structures.

Property.preferredName: Temporomandibular Joint Disorder Chronic Pain Clinical Study Interest
Property.preferredDefinition: Any condition affecting the anatomic and functional characteristics of the temporomandibular joint.:Pain that can range from mild to severe, and persists or progresses over a long period of time.:Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, mechanism of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiology, behavior and health services research. :A state of curiosity or concern about or attention to something

Concepts.definition: A disorder that affects the masticatory muscles and temporomandibular joint.
Ongoing or recurrent pain that persists beyond that which is expected following acute injury, usually 3 months or more.

Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, study of mechanisms of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiologic, behavior, and health services research.
A state of curiosity or concern about or attention to something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: PEARL CRF:Practitioners Engaged in Applied Research and Learning Network Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
